channel.title: March
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: February 29
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Color Song

Tune: If You're Happy and You Know It (You can do the motions too)

If you are wearing red, shake your head.
If you are wearing red, shake your head.
If you are wearing red,
Then please shake your head.
If you are wearing red, shake your head.

If you are wearing blue, touch your shoe.
If you are wearing blue, touch your shoe.
If you are wearing blue,
Then please touch your shoe.
If you are wearing blue, touch your shoe.

If you are wearing green, bow to the queen.
If you are wearing green, bow to the queen.
If you are wearing green,
Then please bow to the queen.
If you are wearing green, bow to the queen.

If you are wearing black, pat your back.
If you are wearing black, pat your back.
If you are wearing black,
Then please pat your back.
If you are wearing black, pat your back.

If you are wearing brown, turn around.
If you are wearing brown, turn around.
If you are wearing brown,
Then please turn around.
If you are wearing brown, turn around.

If you are wearing other colors, shake like Jell-O
If you are wearing yellow, shake like Jell-O
If you are wearing yellow,
Then please shake like Jell-O
If you are wearing yellow, shake like Jell-O.

Watch

Leap Year Frog Countdown

Try This

Today is a rainbow day!

Sing the Finding Colors Song. At the end of each vers, see what you and your child can find of that color.

 

Finding Colors
Tune: The Muffin Man

Oh, can you find the color blue,
The color blue, the color blue?
Oh, can you find the color blue,
Somewhere in this room?

Sing many different verses with all the colors you can think of!

TumbleBooks

One Duck Stuck - Phyllis Root

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Family Rainbow Hands Craft - Everyone in the family can work together to make a huge rainbow craft.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• There Was An Old Lady Who Swallowed Some Snow by Lucille Colandro and Jared Lee
• Whatever After #6: Cold As Ice by Sarah Mlynowski
• Hot Dog, Cold Dog by Frann Preston-Gannon
• The Shortest Day: Celebrating the Winter Solstice by Wendy Pfeffer and Jessie Reisch
• Sally In the Snow by Stephen Huneck
• The Winter Book by Rotraut Susanne Berner
• It's Snowing! It's Snowing: Winter Poems by Jack Prelutsky and Yossi Abolafia
• The Snowman by Raymond Briggs
• A Warm Winter Tail by Carrie A. Pearson and Christina Wald
• Petal's First Winter by Joy Findlay
• Fancy Nancy: Heart to Heart by Jane O'Connor and Robin Preiss Glasser
• Ready For Winter by Marthe Jocelyn
• Winter by Nuria Roca
• Mouse and Mole, A Winter Wonderland by Wong Herbert Yee
• I See Winter by Charles Ghigna and Ag Jatkowska
• Snowflakes Fall by Patricia Maclachlan and Steven Kellogg
• The Sniffles for Bear by Bonnie Becker and Kady MacDonald Denton
• Sick of Being Sick by Justin Sullivan and Keika Yamaguchi
• Bear Feels Sick by Karma Wilson and Jane Chapman
• Heidi Heckelbeck Gets the Sniffles by Wanda Coven and Priscilla Burris
• Sniffles by Robert D. Larranaga
• Llama Llama Home With Mama by Anna Dewdney
• The Flea's Sneeze by Lynn Downey and Karla Firehammer
• The Seven Sneezes by Golden Books and Bruce Ingman
• Because A Little Bug Went Ka-Choo by Rosetta Stone and Michael Frith
• Tumptin's Sneeze by Kathy Webb Penrod
• Tallulah Louise and The Terrible Sneeze by Shawnda Blake
• Sneezy the Snowman by Maureen Wright and Stephen Gilpin
• Benjamin's Lost Sneeze by Chelsey Patriss
• Too Cold For A Tutu by Mini Goss

Artwork by Barry Gott iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in February around the state. Here are two unique events in February worth exploring!

  • Washington Golf Show - Chantilly
  • Greater Richmond Convention Center Home and Garden Show - Richmond
  • First Friday Spring Art Walk - Martinsville
  • McLean Jewelry Showcase - McLean
  • Fredericksburg Train and Toy Show - Fredericksburg
  • Expo Yard Sales and Market - Fishersville
  • Business and Technology Showcase - Salem
  • 30th Annual Richmond Camping RV Expo - Richmond
  • Chantilly Gun and Knife Show - Chantilly
  • Hampton World of Pets Expo - Hampton
  • Fredericksburg Kids Expo - Fredericksburg
  • Virginia Wine Expo - Richmond
  • 27th Annual Richmond Boat Show - Richmond
  • Spotsylvania Towne Center Mall Spring Home Show - Fredericksburg
  • Chantilly International Gem and Jewelry Show - Chantilly
  • Virginia Beach Train and Toy Show - Virginia Beach
  • Harrisonburg Spring Gun Show - Harrisonburg
  • The Big Day Bridal Show - Fredericksburg
  • Virginia Beach Vow Bridal Show - Virginia Beach
  • Greater Richmond Virginia Bridal Show - Richmond
  • Mid-Atlantic Motosport and RV Show - Fredericksburg
  • DC Bluegrass Festival - Vienna
  • Washington, DC Area Reptile Expo - Leesburg
  • Doswell Gun Show - Doswell
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 28
item.description:
Sing a Song

Down by the Bay

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a bear? Combing his hair?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a goose? Kissing a moose?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a whale? With a polka dot tail?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a pig? Wearing a wig?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay, Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a cat? Wearing a hat?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a dragon? Pulling a wagon?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,
Cause if I do,
My mother will say,

"Did you ever see a goat? Wearing a coat?" Down by the bay.

Down by the bay,
Where the watermelons grow,
Back to my home,
I dare not go,

Cause if I do,
My mother will say,
"Did you ever have a time? When you couldn't find a rhyme?"Down by the bay.

Watch

Color Matching Game

Try This

Today is a rainbow day.

Make bubbles with dish soap and water. What colors are your child's bubbles?

Sing the bubble song together while your child plays in the tub:

Dip your pipe and gently blow
Watch the tiny bubble grow
Big and bigger, round and fat
Rainbow colored and then…
SPLAT!

TumbleBooks

Seahorses - Judy Wearing

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Create Your Own Soap Bubble Art - Did you know that you can make a painting with bubbles?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 27
item.description:
Sing a Song

Baa Baa Black Sheep

There are sheep of many different colors and many different kinds of wool.

Baa baa black sheep have you any wool?
Yes sir, yes sir, three bags full.
One for my master and one for my dame,
One for the little boy who lives down the lane.
Baa baa black sheep have you any wool?
Yes sir, yes sir, three bags full.

Try This

Today's colors are black and white. Spend time with your child cutting black and white letters out of a newspaper or magazine. You child can glue the letters onto paper or a paper plate for his or her very own name plate.

TumbleBooks

Animals Black And White - Phyllis Limbacher Tildes

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

Baa, Baa Black Sheep

Explore More

  • 60 Second Hat with Newspaper - Here are two activities that need only some newspaper, scissors, and tape! How will you decorate your hat?
  • Newspaper Apron - Make an apron for art time!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 26
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Little Red Hen Song

Tune: Mulberry Bush

This is the way I plant the seed,
Plant the seed, plant the seed,
This is the way I plant the seed,
So early in the morning.

This is the way I cut the wheat,
Cut the wheat, cut the wheat,
This is the way I cut the wheat,
So early in the morning.

This is the way I go to the mill,
Go to the mill, go to the mill,
This is the way I go to the mill,
So early in the morning.

This is the way I make the dough,
Make the dough, make the dough,
This is the way I make the dough,
So early in the morning.

This is the way I bake the bread,
Bake the bread, bake the bread,
This is the way I bake the bread,
So early in the morning.

This is the way I eat the bread,
Eat the bread, eat the bread,
This is the way I eat the bread,
So early in the morning.

Watch

The Little Red Hen

Try This

Today’s color is red.

Take a walk as a family and collect pine needles or pine straw. When you get back, have your child dip the pine needles in red paint and use them to paint a picture.

TumbleBooks

Red is Best - Kathy Stinson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • The Little Red Hen on Starfall - Listen to the classic story of the Little Red Hen. Everyone can watch the animation and older children can read along.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 25
item.description:
Sing a Song

Row, Row, Row Your Boat

Sing Row, Row, Row Your Boat. If you have others with you, you can sing in a round.

Row Your Boat
Row, row, row your boat
Gently down the stream.
Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily
Life is but a dream.

Watch

Row Row Row Your Boat Chomp

Try This

Today's color is navy blue. Spend some time looking through magazines or books and seeing all the things that are navy blue. What is your favorite? Talk about why this shade of blue is called navy blue.

TumbleBooks

The Hockey Card - Jack Siemiatycki and Avi Slodovnick

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Sailboat Crafts for Kids - You and your child can make several kinds of craft sailboats that really float.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Life of a Butterfly

Here’s a song you can sing about a butterfly. Tune: Skip To My Lou

I'm a caterpillar, wiggle with me,
I'm a caterpillar, wiggle with me,
I'm a caterpillar, wiggle with me,
What'll I be, my darlin'?

Z Z Z Z Z
A chrysalis, now sleep like me,
A chrysalis, now sleep like me,
A chrysalis, now sleep like me,
What'll I be, my darlin'?

A butterfly, come fly with me,
A butterfly, come fly with me,
A butterfly, come fly with me,
What'll I be, my darlin'?

Now all together, let's do all 3 three.

A caterpillar, a chrysalis,
A butterfly - three.
Move your body like this with me.
The life of a butterfly, darlin'.

Try This

Today’s color is purple.

Can you make a butterfly out of shades of purple? Try making different shades of purple paint and then paint butterflies.

TumbleBooks

Purple, Green, and Yellow - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

Sesame Street: Elmo & The Butterfly

Explore More

  • Butterflies of the Carolinas & Virginias - Click on each butterfly name to see a picture!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 23
item.description:
There Was a Little Turtle

This is a great rhyme to use hand motions.

There was a little turtle.
(one hand over the other, wiggle thumb)

He lived in a box.
(make box with both hands)

He swam in a puddle,
(make circles in palm of hand)

And he climbed on rocks.
(climb fingers over other hand)

He snapped at a mosquito,
(snap thumb and fingers together)

He snapped at a flea,
(repeat snap)

He snapped at a minnow,
(repeat snap)

And he snapped at me.
(point to self)

He caught the mosquito,
(clap hands)
He caught the flea,
(clap hands)
He caught the minnow,
(clap hands)
But he didn't catch me!
(point to self and shake head)

Watch

There Was A Little Turtle

Try This

Today’s color is lime green.

Talk about all the things that grow! How many are lime green? There are birds that are lime green, and trees, and fruit (like limes!)

TumbleBooks

When Turtle Grew Feathers - Tim Tingle

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Turtle Tails - Make kid sized turtle shells, then play the turtle tails game!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 22
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Little Robins

Robins are birds which are red. Here is a rhyme about robins!

Five little robins lived in a tree.
A father, a mother, and babies three.
Father caught a worm,
Mother caught a bug,
This one got the bug,
This one got the worm,
And this one sat and waited for his turn.

Try This

Today’s colors are crimson and gold. Let’s make a baggy fish!

Take a brown paper bag and fill it with newspaper. Tie the end of the bag with a twist tie or rubber band. Cut the end part into two fins. Then decorate the fish using crimson and gold and any other colors you want to make your fish look festive!

TumbleBooks

Diary Of A Worm - Doreen Cronin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

PBS Kids: Fish by Mary Ann Hoberman

Explore More

  • Baggy Fish Craft - Here is another baggy fish activity; this one is from Crayola.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 21
item.description:
Sing a Song

Rainbow Colors

Here is a song about all the colors of the rainbow. Tune: Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star

Rainbow purple, rainbow blue,
Rainbow green and yellow too.
Rainbow orange, rainbow red,
Rainbow smiling overhead.

Come and count
The colors with me.
How many colors
Can you see?

Watch

The Rainbow Fish

Try This

Today is a rainbow day! You can make paint today. You can use:

  • A sprinkle of drink mix like kool-aid and water
  • Shaving cream, cold cream or Yogurt and food coloring
  • You can use fingers or brushes to make a rainbow! Talk about when you might see a rainbow.

Sing the painting song:

I know my colors for painting fun
green like the grass and the yellow sun,
an orange pumpkin and white snow,
a red rose and a black crow,
blue like a mailbox, brown like an ape,
a pink pig and some purple grapes!

TumbleBooks

Art's Supplies - Chris Tougas

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make Your Own Paint - Here are some additional recipes for making kid-friendly pant.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 20
item.description:
Sing a Song

I’m a Lavender Fish

Here’s another song about this particular shade of purple. Tune: I'm a Little Teapot

I'm a lavender fishy, I can swim.
Here is my tail, here is my fin.
When I want to have fun with my friend,
I wiggle my tail and dive right in.

Watch

Otis by Loren Long

Try This

Today’s color is lavender. Have you ever smelled a plant called Lavender?

There is an old song called Lavender’s Blue, Dilly Dilly. Sing a few verses together.

Lavender’s Blue, Dilly Dilly

Lavender's blue, dilly dilly,
Lavender's green.
When you are King, dilly dilly,
I shall be Queen.

Who told you so, dilly dilly,
Who told you so?
'Twas my own heart, dilly dilly,
That told me so.

TumbleBooks

I Got Two Dogs - John Lithgow

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Garden Projects for Kids - Try these garden projects like growing a pizza garden.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 19
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Garden Song

This is called The Garden Song. Sing the chorus softly and think about how things grow.

Inch by inch, row by row
Gonna make this garden grow.
All it takes is a rake and a hoe
And a piece of fertile ground.

Inch by inch, row by row
Someone bless these seeds I sow.
Someone warm them from below
'Till the rain comes tumbling down.

Watch

The Green Grass Grew All Around

Try This

Today’s color is dark green. Talk about all the kinds of trees you can think of and what trees do for us. If you can, take a walk outside to see the trees together as a family.

If you are indoors, try making up a rhyming game for words about trees the outdoors. Help your child think of rhymes for words like: leaf, tree, green, wood, bark, branch, garden, pine cone, etc.

TumbleBooks

Ma, I'm a Farmer - Michael Martchenko

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Indoor Gardening for Kids - You and your child can grow plants, even in the winter!
  • Easy-to-Grow Plants for Kids - Here is a list of plants that are easy to grow-perfect for children's gardens.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 18
item.description:
Georgie Porgie

Mother Goose Time!

Georgie Porgie , pudding and pie;
Kissed the girls and made them cry.
When the boys came out to play,
Georgie Porgie ran away.

Watch

Alice the Camel

Try This

Today’s color is tan.

Think of all the animals that are shades of tan and brown. Draw pictures of these animals and glue or tape them onto popsicle sticks or straws to make puppets!

TumbleBooks

Mason Moves Away - Amy Crane Johnson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Mother Goose for Kids - This website has sing-along rhymes, coloring pages, games, pages from a classic Mother Goose book, and more!
  • Inkless Tales: Mother Goose - Inkless Tales has Mother Goose rhymes and other songs. Some are animated with words and music.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 17
item.description:
Two Little Puppets

You can use your imagination and pretend you have puppets on your hands. Or you can make a puppet using a paper bag (see Arts & Crafts pages).

Two little puppets,
One on each hand.
Isn't she pretty?
Isn't he grand?
Her name is Bella
His name is Beau.
Hear her say "Good Morning."
Hear him say "Hello."

Watch

To Market To Market

Try This

Today’s color is plum. Make up hand motions for these Mother Goose rhymes!

Little Jack Horner

Little Jack Horner
Sat in a corner
Eating his Christmas pie
He put in this thumb
And pulled out a plum
And said “what a good boy am I!”

To Market To Market

To market to market
To buy a plum bun
Home again, home again
Market is done

TumbleBooks

Stella the Star - Mark Shulman

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Paper Bag Monkey Puppet - Print out the monkey face, ears, and tail and glue them on a paper bag for instant monkey fun!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 16
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Green and Speckled Frogs

This is a common song for children. You can find related books and music at the library!

Five green and speckled frogs,
Sat on a speckled log,
Eating some most delicious bugs
YUM YUM!
One jumped down in the pool,
Where it was nice and cool,
Now there's just four green speckled frogs.

Keep singing until there are no more green and speckled frogs!

Watch

Five Green and Speckled Frogs

Try This

Today's color is your favorite color. Point out things with your child's favorite color. Help your child write his or her name using a favorite color. Cut it out and hang it up!

TumbleBooks

Diary of a Spider - Doreen Cronin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Paper Bag Frog Puppet - Make a nifty frog puppet using a paper lunch bag.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

Gently Falling Leaves

Make up your own hand motions to show the falling leaves.

Little leaves fall gently down
Yellow, black, orange and brown
Whirling, whirling round and round
Quietly without a sound.
Falling softly to the ground.
Down and down and down and down.

Watch

Five Little Leaves

Try This

Today's colors are orange and black. Can your child think of an animal that is orange and black? Give a name to the animal and then tell a story about the animal. Have your child draw a picture to go with the story.

TumbleBooks

Cinnamon And The April Shower - Amy Crane Johnson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Animal Photos - Check out these photographs of all different kinds of animals from National Geographic.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 14
item.description:
Sing a Song

PINK

Tune: Jingle Bells

Cotton candy, fat pink pigs,
Girls with socks and bows,
P-i-n-k, p-i-n-k,
That is how it goes!
Bubble gum, valentines,
These are all pink too.
Pink icing and pink balloons,
We can spell, can you? Yes!

Watch

One Pink Valentine

Try This

Today's color is pink.

Pigs and piglets are pink. Can you and your child make a paper plate pig family and give each pig a name that starts with P?

TumbleBooks

Pigs - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Recognize the Color Pink - Can you find everything on the page that is the color pink?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

Purple Violets

Do you like flowers? Here is a poem you can read together about a flower called the violet.

One purple violet in our garden grew;
Up popped another and that made two.
Two purple violets were all that I could see;
But Billy found another and that made three!
I’d make a wreath for Mother,
And that would make four
Four purple violets—sure as you’re alive!
Why here is another and now there are five!

Watch

Is It Yellow? Is It Red? Is It Blue?

Try This

Today’s color is your choice!

Try and visit the library today! Help your child find lots of books with colors.

Check out Eric Carle’s "Brown Bear Brown Bear" and "Harold and the Purple Crayon."

Practice the I Can Read Colors poem.

I Can Read Colors

Orange is an orange;
Yellow is the sun;
Brown is a bear;
and purple is a plum;
Red is an apple;
Green is a tree;
Black is an old man's hat;
I can read, listen to me!

TumbleBooks

Bugs, Bugs, Bugs - Bob Barner

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Paper Mosaic Crafts for Kids - Eric Carle makes pictures for his books using mosaics. You can try these mosaic projects using nothing but paper.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 12
item.description:
Sing a Song

Here is a funny rhyming poem about different colors.

Fred Red bumped his head;
Had to be fed in bed.
Mellow Yellow is a funny fellow;
He only eats yellow Jell-O.
Sue Blue got the flu—
Boo Hoo, Boo Hoo
Jean Green is so mean;
She's the meanest Jean I've seen.
Burple Purple is a nerple!
Ollie Orange ate all the oranges.
John Brown went to town;
He is such a silly clown.
Jack Black sat in the back.
Willie White is always right!

Try This

Today’s color is red.

Make Valentine cards together. Give them to people in your family and to your friends.

TumbleBooks

Red is a Dragon - Roseanne Thong

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

PBS Kids: Chicken Valentine

Explore More

  • Making Valentine Cards - Here are some fun ideas for unique valentine cards to make and give to family and friends.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 11
item.description:
Sing a Song

I Love Colors

Here is a song about all kinds of colors! You can make up your own tune and even hand motions.

Chorus:
I love colors, yes I do!
Red and orange and green and blue!
I love colors, dark or bright,
Yellow, purple, black, and white!

What is red? Juicy beets!
What is brown? Chocolate treats!
What is white? A shiny moon!
What is gray? A big baboon!

Chorus:
What is orange? Carrot sticks!
What is yellow? Baby chicks!
What is gold? Bright goldfish!
What is black? Licorice!

Chorus:
What is green? Grass so high!
What is blue? The open sky!
What is purple? Eggplant shells!
What is silver? Silver bells!

Try This

Today’s colors are silver and gold.

For older children, have them count a small handful of coins. They can make rubbings of the coins by placing paper over the coins and rubbing a crayon over them. Coins are a choking hazard for children under 4. You can talk about the silver stars and sing Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star.

TumbleBooks

Burro's Tortillas - Terri Fields

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Twinkle Twinkle Little Star

Explore More

  • How to Do a Coin Rubbing on Paper - This easy project teaches small children about coin denominations.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 10
item.description:
Sing a Song

Sing a Song of Sixpence

Mother Goose Time!

Sing a song of sixpence,
A pocketful of rye;
Four and twenty blackbirds,
Baked in a pie.

When the pie was opened,
The birds began to sing;
Wasn't that a dainty dish,
To put before the king?

The king was in the counting-house,
Counting out his money;
The queen was in the parlor,
Eating bread and honey.

The maid was in the garden,
Hanging out the clothes;
When down came a blackbird,
And bit her on the nose.

Watch

Sing a Song of Sixpence

Try This

Today’s color is black. Together, play the “Miss Mary Mack” hand rhyme. For young ones, just try clapping hands together.

Miss Mary Mack

Miss Mary Mack Mack Mack
She’s dressed in black black black
With silver buttons buttons buttons
All down her back back back
She asked her mother mother mother
For fifty cents cents cents
To watch the elephant elephant elephant
Jump over the fence, fence fence
He jumped so high high high
He reached the sky sky sky
And he never came back back back
Til the fourth of July July July

TumbleBooks

Dad Runs Away With the Circus - Edgar Keret

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Miss Mary Mack Clapping Game - Here is the clapping pattern for the song. Feel free to change the pattern or just clap your hands and sing!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 9
item.description:
Sing a Song

Snow Sledding

Tune: Mary had a Little Lamb

Snow piled up will make a hill,
make a hill, make a hill
Snow piled up will make a hill
for sliding in the yard.

We rolled it up in great big balls,
great big balls, great big balls.
We rolled it up in great big balls,
and pound it 'till it's hard.

Though other children call to us,
call to us, call to us.
Though other children call to us
to take our sleds outside.

We don't go out but stay right home,
stay right home, stay right home.
We don't go out but stay right home,
and slide and slide and slide.

TumbleBooks

Who Likes The Snow? - Etta Kaner

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Today’s color is white!

Make little snow men out of white cotton balls with your child and practice counting.

What are your favorite things that are white?

Watch

Mary Had a Little Lamb

Explore More

  • List of Things that are White - Talk about things that are white today and use this list to find some you may not have thought about.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 8
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Bear Went Over the Mountain

Some bears are brown. Do you know this bear song? Tune: For He's a Jolly Good Fellow

The bear went over the mountain,
The bear went over the mountain,
The bear went over the mountain,
To see what he could see

To see what he could see,
To see what he could see

The other side of the mountain,
The other side of the mountain,
The other side of the mountain,
Was all that he could see

Was all that he could see,
Was all that he could see,
The other side of the mountain,
Was all that he could see!

Try This

Today’s color is brown. Can you do the Teddy Bear action rhyme? For young ones, try bouncing them up and down and clapping hands.

Teddy Bear

Teddy Bear, Teddy Bear
Turn around
Teddy Bear Teddy Bear
Touch the ground
Teddy Bear Teddy Bear
Turn off the light
Teddy Bear Teddy Bear
Say good night

TumbleBooks

The Bears We Know - Brenda Silsbe

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

PBS Kids: Elephants Can Paint Too

Explore More

  • Fingerplays & Action Rhymes - Babies and toddlers love fingerplays. Here are classics and new ones to try.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 7
item.description:
Sing a Song

The More We Get Together

Sing a song about friendship.

The more we get together,
together, together,
The more we get together
The happier we'll be.
For your friends are my friends,
and my friends are your friends.
The more we get together
The happier we'll be.

Try This

Today's colors are yours to choose!

Make a giant heart in lots of colors for your library or librarian. Take it to the library next time you visit and tell the librarian why you love your library!

TumbleBooks

Always - Alison McGhee

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

StoryBlocks: De Colores

Explore More

  • Craft Projects for Kids - Check out this list of super craft ideas. Most have pictures of the art project.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 6
item.description:
Sing a Song

A-Tisket, A-Tasket

Mother Goose Time!

A-tisket, a-tasket,
A green and yellow basket.
I wrote a letter to my love,
But on the way I dropped it.
I dropped it, I dropped it,
And, on the way I dropped it.
A little boy picked it up,
And put it in his pocket.

Try This

Today’s colors are neon—which are very bright shades. Can you think when you and your child might have seen neon colors?

Can you make up a rhyme about neon colors?

TumbleBooks

All Aboard The Dinotrain - Deb Lund

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

StoryBlocks: Itsy Bitsy Spider

Explore More

  • Mother Goose Nursery Rhymes - Need the perfect Mother Goose rhyme for any occasion? Find the words here.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 5
item.description:
Sing a Song

Traffic Light Song

Tune: The People on the Bus

What do you do when the light turns red?
The light turns red,
the light turns red?
What do you do when the light turns red?
Red means you stop.

What do you do when the light turns yellow?
The light turns yellow,
the light turns yellow?
What do you do when the light turns yellow?
Yellow means you look.

What do you do when the light turns green?
The light turns green, the light turns green?
What do you do when the light turns green?
Green means you go slow.

Watch

Red Light, Green Light Game

Try This

Today's colors are the colors of the traffic lights: red, yellow and green!

Talk about what the colors mean and how they guide you to cross the street safely.

Play "Red Light, Green Light."

TumbleBooks

50 Below Zero - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Games Kids Play - This website features playground games, jump-rope rhymes, and more.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 4
item.description:
Sing a Song

A Sailor Went to Sea

Today’s color is blue like the sea! Sing A Sailor Went to Sea and use hand motions.

A Sailor went to sea sea sea
To see what he could see see see
But all that he could see see see
Was the bottom of the deep blue sea sea sea

Talk about all the things that you can think of that are blue!

TumbleBooks

Frank and Izzy Set Sail - Laura McGee Kvasnosky

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Mother Goose Time!

I Saw a Ship A-Sailing

I saw a ship a-sailing,
A-sailing on the sea,
And, oh! it was all laden,
With pretty things for thee.

There were comfits in the cabin,
And apples in the hold;
The sails were made of silk,
And the masts were made of gold.

The four-and-twenty sailors,
That stood between the decks,
Were four-and-twenty white mice
With chains around their necks.

The captain was a duck,
With a packet on his back;
And when the ship began to move,
The captain said, "Quack! Quack!"

Watch

The Pirates Song

Explore More

  • How to Make a Paper Boat - Make an armada of paper boats and sail them around the house.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 3
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Clouds in the Sky

Sometimes the sky is blue and sometimes the sky is gray. Here is a song about the clouds called The Clouds In The Sky. Tune: The Wheels on the Bus

The clouds in the sky go
Boom, boom, boom,
Boom, boom, boom,
Boom, boom, boom.
(clap hands on "boom")
The clouds in the sky go
Boom, boom, boom.
All night and day.

The rain falling down goes
Plink, plink, plink......
(move fingers down in front )
All night and day.
Sad little children cry
Go away, go away, go away......
(sad faces, wipe eyes)
All night and day.
The flowers and the trees go
Yum, yum, yum.....
(rub tummy)
All night and day.
The creatures all around go
Scrub, scrub, scrub......
(wash self all over)
All night and day.

The sun behind the clouds says
Move away, move away, move away.....
(push clouds away)
All night and day.
The clouds in the sky say
See you soon, see you soon, see you soon.....
(wave)
All night and day.

Try This

Today's color is gray. Castles are often gray and made of stone. Can you and your child draw a castle and then make up a story about the family that lives in the castle?

TumbleBooks

Castle On Hester Street - Linda Heller

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Watch

PBS Kids: Windy McCloud Talks About Precipitation

Explore More

  • Castles for Kids - Explore this site about castles with your child and print the coloring pages to learn more about castles!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 2
item.description:
Sing a Song

Pumpkins are orange! Here is a pumpkin poem to read together.

Cut into a pumpkin;
Scoop it with a spoon;
Carve a little mouth
That is shaped like a moon.
Cut two eyes to twinkle,
And a big three cornered nose.
Use for teeth, ten shiny seeds,
And place them in a row.

Watch

Looking for a Friend

Try This

Today’s color is orange. Help your child name as many fruits and their colors as possible. Start with orange!

TumbleBooks

Winter Is The Warmest Season - Lauren Stringer

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Rainbow Fruit Salad - Try this tasty recipe and watch your kids try new fruits!
  • Fruit Pizza - Turn ordinary pizza into a fruit explosion.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: February 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Color Song

Tune: If You're Happy and You Know It (You can do the motions too)

If you are wearing red, shake your head.
If you are wearing red, shake your head.
If you are wearing red,
Then please shake your head.
If you are wearing red, shake your head.

If you are wearing blue, touch your shoe.
If you are wearing blue, touch your shoe.
If you are wearing blue,
Then please touch your shoe.
If you are wearing blue, touch your shoe.

If you are wearing green, bow to the queen.
If you are wearing green, bow to the queen.
If you are wearing green,
Then please bow to the queen.
If you are wearing green, bow to the queen.

If you are wearing black, pat your back.
If you are wearing black, pat your back.
If you are wearing black,
Then please pat your back.
If you are wearing black, pat your back.

If you are wearing brown, turn around.
If you are wearing brown, turn around.
If you are wearing brown,
Then please turn around.
If you are wearing brown, turn around.

If you are wearing other colors, shake like Jell-O
If you are wearing yellow, shake like Jell-O
If you are wearing yellow,
Then please shake like Jell-O
If you are wearing yellow, shake like Jell-O.

Watch

The Muffin Man

Try This

Today is a rainbow day!

Sing the Finding Colors Song. At the end of each vers, see what you and your child can find of that color.

 

Finding Colors
Tune: The Muffin Man

Oh, can you find the color blue,
The color blue, the color blue?
Oh, can you find the color blue,
Somewhere in this room?

Sing many different verses with all the colors you can think of!

TumbleBooks

One Duck Stuck - Phyllis Root

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Family Rainbow Hands Craft - Everyone in the family can work together to make a huge rainbow craft.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)
